These nocturnal stalkers tail their chosen quarry for days, even weeks at a time, ominously showing up in back alleys, shadowy street corners, and even in victims’ own homes before going in for the kill. For unfathomable reasons, a bogeyman may spare a victim’s life and instead kidnap them, absconding to a far-off location before returning years later with a fresh bogey in tow. **[Recall Knowledge - Fey](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 29 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 24 [Bogeyman](/Monsters.aspx?ID=509) **Source** [Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God](/Sources.aspx?ID=23) pg. 79 **Perception** +19; low-light vision **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10); [_tongues_](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +23, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +19, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +22, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +22, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +16, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +23, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) +21 **Str** +5 **Dex** +7 **Con** +4 **Int** +0 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 30 **Fort** +16 **Ref** +23 **Will** +19 **HP** 175 ([fast healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=15) 10) **Immunities** fear **Weaknesses** cold iron 10 **Deepest Fear** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) 60 feet. A bogeyman’s aura of terror manifests as a shifting haze of images that reflect the viewers’ deepest fears. Whenever a creature ends its turn within the aura, it must succeed at a DC 28 Will save or become [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19). A creature’s frightened condition (including from striking fear) does not reduce as long as the creature remains in the aura. If the creature succeeds at its saving throw, it becomes temporarily immune to the aura for 24 hours. --- **Speed** 30 feet; mobility **Melee** claw +21 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 2d12+9 slashing plus striking fear **Occult Innate Spells** DC 27 - **Cantrips (4th)** [Ghost Sound](/Spells.aspx?ID=132), [Message](/Spells.aspx?ID=190) - **2nd** [Knock](/Spells.aspx?ID=168) (at will) - **3rd** [Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110), [Mind Reading](/Spells.aspx?ID=194) - **4th** [Gaseous Form](/Spells.aspx?ID=129), [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164), [Nightmare](/Spells.aspx?ID=208), [Phantasmal Killer](/Spells.aspx?ID=219) - **Constant (4th)** [Tongues](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) **Devour Soul** ([Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) **Requirements** The bogeyman has killed a creature within the last round and is adjacent to the creature; **Effect** The bogeyman consumes the creature’s soul. The soul is utterly destroyed—nothing short of wish or a similar effect can restore it to life, and only after the bogeyman has been slain. The bogeyman regains Hit Points equal to double the level of the consumed creature. Each time the bogeyman consumes 10 souls, it increases its level by 1, and its statistics improve accordingly. **Mobility** When the bogeyman uses a Stride action to move half their Speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions. **[Sneak Attack](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=34)** The bogeyman deals 1d6 extra precision damage to [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) creatures. **Striking Fear** ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) If a bogeyman scores a critical hit with a claw Strike, the target must attempt a DC 29 Will save. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target is [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19).
**Failure** The target is frightened 2.
**Critical Failure** The target is frightened 3 and [fleeing](/Conditions.aspx?ID=17) for 1 round. **Surprise Attack** On the first round of combat, creatures that haven’t acted yet are flat-footed to the bogeyman.
